chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Everett J Hembrook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 118 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 22CM01391

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. 
Note - Costs from cases 22CM1391, 22CM1175 and 22CM1182 are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision on this case.

Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Complete the Thinking for a Change course. 
Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week) Obtain a valid driver's license within the first 12 months of Extended Supervision and maintain it. No new law violations.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:05 AM Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Everett J Hembrook.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have received a global offer and request a plea and sentenicing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Michael Osborne in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Everett J Hembrook.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Deputy Daniel Lambert sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Osborne.  Cross examination by Attorney Herbers.  Redirect by Attorney Osborne.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Herbers objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A (except for in their official capacity) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

01:53 PM Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
